text: Sir Alec John Jeffreys (born 9 January 1950) is a British geneticist. He developed techniques for genetic fingerprinting and DNA profiling which are now used worldwide in forensic science. The information helps police detective work and solves paternity and immigration disputes.DNA pioneer's 'eureka' moment BBC. Retrieved 14 October 2011 Jeffreys is a professor of genetics at the University of Leicester. In 1989, he was elected a member of the Academia Europaea. He became an honorary freeman of the City of Leicester on 26 November 1992. In 1994, he was knighted for services to genetics. == References == Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:People from Oxford Category:English geneticists Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:Knights Bachelor Category:University of Leicester
title: Alec Jeffreys
